Name: HMS Coventry
Builder: Swan Hunter and Wigham Richardson, Wallsend-on-Tyne
Reclassified: Converted to Anti-Aircraft cruiser before the Second World War
Propulsion:
Two Brown-Curtis geared turbines
Six Yarrow boilers
Two propellers
40,000 shp
Range: carried 300 tons (950 tons maximum) of fuel oil
Armament:
(as built):
5 × 6-inch (152 mm) (152 mm) guns
2 × 3-inch (76 mm) (76 mm) guns
2 × 2-pounder (40 mm) guns
8 × 21-inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
(At outbreak of World War 2):
10 × 4-inch (102 mm) (102 mm) guns on high-angle mounts
8 × 12.7mm machine guns on two quad mounts
Armour:
3 inch side (amidships)
2¼-1½ inch side (bows)
2 inch side (stern)
1 inch upper decks (amidships)
1 inch deck over rudder
